item.title: NBA-Shotchart
item.description: An interactive dashboard for NBA player shot data. Note: currently under maintaince as NBA has imposed CORS restrictions that prevent the package from being used in a browser directly Work Summary Built and deployed a dashboard using React JS, D3 and Ant Design to visualize NBA players’ shot performance Improved user experience by adding 4 data filters and an autocomplete search bar providing player image preview Developed 2 shot themes to demonstrate frequency-efficiency and distance-action relations

item.title: Tweety Pipe
item.description: A real-time data processor built with Spark and Kafka. Data visualized with a simple Flask app and Chart.js Work Summary Implemented a real-time data processor with Spark and Flask to visualize trending Twitter hashtags Designed and implemented a real-time sentiment monitor with Kafka, processing 3500 Tweets per minute Visualized results with Ajax and Chart.js for 1% of all public Tweets Technologies involved: Python, Spark, Kafka, Flask, Google Compute Engine, Twitter API

item.title: Projects
item.description: Tweety-Pipe: A Real-Time Data Processor with Spark and Kafka NBA-Shortchart: An Interactive Visualization Dashboard for NBA player Shot Data AFK, grabbing lunch, more to come!

item.title: Education
item.description: Vanderbilt University Master of Science (May 2023) Major: Computer Science University of Toronto, St. George Honours Bachelor of Science (June 2021) Specialist: Computer Science, Minors: Statistics, Math Upper-level CS GPA: 3.86/4.0 Final two-year GPA: 3.92/4.0 Courses include: Operating Systems, Parallel Programming, Computer Networks, Deep Learning & Neural Networks, Statistical ML, Mobile Robotics, Image Understanding, Software Engineering, Algorithms & Data Structures, Programming Languages

item.title: Work
item.description: LinkedIn - Ads Serving LinkedIn Ads - Worked on LinkedIn’s real-time ads bidding system to serve high-quality ads to hundreds of millions of members when they are not on LinkedIn, expanding reach and driving superior monetary and marketing results Software Engineer Intern 05/2022 – 08/2022 Mountain View, CA Designed and developed a distributed remote cache for LinkedInâ€™s real-time bidding system with 1 million peak QPS using Java. Reduced the end-to-end latency for real-time creative rendering by ~40% and improved the cache hit rate by 62% in production, enabling AI-powered and SLA-aware features to serve higher-quality ads.
